SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.google.api.ads.dfp.lib
Class ServiceAccountantManager

java.lang.Object
  com.google.api.ads.dfp.lib.ServiceAccountantManager

public final class ServiceAccountantManager
extends java.lang.Object

The ServiceAccountantManager manages all instances of ServiceAccountant by reference to the javax.xml.rpc.Service hashcode.

This class is intended to be used by the HTTP transport layer of the Axis engine; i.e. DfpHttpSender.invoke(MessageContext) calls recordMessage(MessageContext).

The default behavior of the manager is to create service accountants automatically when the first response is received for that service and to not retain a reference to that service. A service which accounting is enabled for is called a "registered" service. A service which has its reference managed by this manager is called a "retained" service. If you would like to retain references to all created services (so this class can be used a service manager), then setRetainServices(boolean) should be called with true. This can also be set by setting the jvm property: com.google.api.ads.dfp.lib.serviceaccountantmanager.retainservice=true

For memory management, the clear() method can be used to remove all references to services so that they may be garbage collected. Again, this is only needed if service retention is enabled (not by default).

Author:
api.arogal@gmail.com (Adam Rogal)

Method Detail

getInstance

public static ServiceAccountantManager getInstance()
Gets the singleton instance of the ServiceAccountantManager, in which the service accountant will be automatically created upon the first service call and services will not be retained.

Returns:
the singleton instance of the ServiceAccountantManager

setAutoCreateAccountant

public void setAutoCreateAccountant(boolean autoCreateAccountant)
Sets the service accountant manager to auto create the service accountant upon the first call.

Parameters:
autoCreateAccountant - true if a service accountant should be created on first call to the service it represents

isAutoCreateAccountant

public boolean isAutoCreateAccountant()
Returns true if service accountant auto creation is turned on.

Returns:
true if service accountant auto creation is turned on

setRetainServices

public void setRetainServices(boolean retainServices)
Sets the service accountant manager to retain services on a putService(Stub, DfpUser) call, instead of just the hash code of the service. The services can then be pulled by calling getRetainedServicesForUser(DfpUser).

Parameters:
retainServices - true if a service accountant should be created on first call to the service it represents

isRetainServices

public boolean isRetainServices()
Returns true if service retention is turned on.

Returns:
true if service retention is turned on

Clears the service accountant manager's counters.

Creates an association between the service and the user so that the user can be recalled in the future using just the service.

Parameters:
stub - the DFP service
user - the DfpUser to association with the service

the service accountant or null, if one does not exist

getRetainedServicesForUser

public org.apache.axis.client.Stub[] getRetainedServicesForUser(DfpUser user)
Gets all retained services belonging to a user. Retained services are services that are still referenced by this manager. This will only return a populated array if setRetainServices(boolean) was set to true.

Parameters:
user - the user which was used to generate the services
Returns:
all services belonging to a user

getAllRetainedServices

public java.util.Map<DfpUser,org.apache.axis.client.Stub[]> getAllRetainedServices()
Gets all retained services referenced by their user. Retained services are services that are still referenced by this manager. This will only return a populated map if setRetainServices(boolean) was set to true. If service retention is off, this will return a map of all registered users to empty arrays.

Returns:
all services belonging to the manager

getNumberRetainedServices

public int getNumberRetainedServices()
Gets the number of retained services. Retained services are services that are still referenced by this manager.

Returns:
the number of retained services

Returns:
the number of retained services for a user

getNumberRegisteredServices

public int getNumberRegisteredServices()

the number of registered services
